---
title: "World plot"
output: html_document
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(rworldmap)
library(ggplot2)
map.world <- map_data(map="world")

colnames(map.world)[5] <- "CountryName"
ourindex <- read_csv("CalculatedOurindex.csv")

#Add the data you want to map countries by to map.world

map.world <- left_join(ourindex, map.world, "CountryName")
map.world <- map.world %>% select(finalindex, CountryName, region, sub.region, lat, long)

gg <- ggplot()
gg <- gg + theme()
gg <- gg + geom_map(data=map.world, map=map.world, aes(map_id=region, x=long, y=lat, fill=finalindex))

gg <- gg + scale_fill_gradient(low = "green", high = "brown3", guide = "colourbar")
gg <- gg + coord_equal()
gg
```
